intro: Plesioneuron archboldiae, commonly known as the Socotra cypress, is a unique and rare plant endemic to the island of Socotra. It is a gymnosperm, specifically a member of the family Cupressaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, twisted, and often gnarled appearance. The plant has scale-like leaves and produces small, cone-like structures that contain its seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and human activities.
